description: Exports walls to geometry sets. If no range is specified, then all walls in the model are exported. At the moment, it is only possible to export walls to geometry sets. The geometry sets may in turn be directly used for post-processing or exported as STL files to be used by third-party CAD software.

keywords.name: geometry
keywords.description: Export to geometry sets. Use 'set' to specify base name, 'split' to export each wall to separate sets

keywords.name: set
keywords.description: Set geometry set base name to s. Default: 'walls'. If split is used, each wall gets name like 'basename_wall1'. Otherwise all walls go into one set named s

keywords.name: split
keywords.description: Export each wall into a dedicated geometry set. Default: all walls into one set. Note: existing sets with same name are overridden

examples.description: Export all walls into one geometry set named 'walls' (default)
Export all walls into one geometry set named 'mygeometry'
Export each wall into separate geometry sets named 'walls_wall1', 'walls_wall2', etc.
Export each wall into separate geometry sets named 'boundary_wall1', 'boundary_wall2', etc.

examples.command: wall export geometry set 'container' range name 'box'
examples.description: Export walls named 'box' into geometry set 'container'
Export walls with IDs 1-10 into geometry set 'walls'

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('wall export geometry ...') - Python SDK does not provide wall export functionality
